Technique: DOVETAIL (JOINT); WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Greek papyrus
Description: This fragment of papyrus, which comes from the town of  Tholtis (P.Hib. I 62) and which dates from the year 245 B.C., contains an administrative letter concerning a theft. The first side numbers 17 lines of text and the second side one only.
